intro: Hedlundia leyana, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, velvety leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, often reaching a height of about 30 cm. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and bloom throughout the year under optimal conditions. Hedlundia leyana is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
